page.title: 12LEISURE IN BRIDGE END
page.content: 41 CHILDREN BETWEEN 5 AND 12 YEARS OLD WERE ASKED ABOUT THEIR LEISURE INTERESTS. THE MOST POPULAR WAS WATCHING T.V.WHICH EVERYONE DID. JUST UNDER HALF OF THE CHILDREN WENT TO UNIFORMED ORGANISATIONS. IN BRIDGE END THE MOST POPULAR AGE FOR BELONGING TO A YOUTH ORGANISATION IS 9 TO 10 OR P.5 AGE GROUP. ONLY 3 CHILDREN DID NOT OWN A BIKE. OVER HALF OF THE CHILDREN SOMETIMES GO OUTSIDE BURRA FOR THEIR LEISURE INTERESTS, MAINLY TO THE SWIMMING POOL OR TO THE NEW CLICKIMIN CENTRE.THIRTY THREE OF THE CHILDREN REGULARLY WENT OUT IN BOATS, MOSTLY WITH THEIR FAMILIES, ALTHOUGH 6 WERE ALLOWED OUT ON THEIR OWN.THE SAME NUMBER REGULARLY WENT SWIMMING. 24 CHILDREN PLAY A MUSICAL INSTRUMENT MAINLY THE PIANO, RECORDER, FIDDLE OR GUITAR. A THIRD OF THE CHILDREN HAD COMPUTERS AT HOME.
